unnormalised: The Delhi govt. announced a new scholarship scheme for underprivileged students on 16/07/2024. It's called the "Shiksha Uday" program and aims to provide financial assistance of up to Rs. 25,000 per annum to students from class 1 to class 12. Applications are open till 31st August 2024.
normalised: The Delhi government announced a new scholarship scheme for underprivileged students on sixteenth july two thousand and twenty four. It's called the "Shiksha Uday" program and aims to provide financial assistance of up to rupee twenty five thousand per annum to students from class one to class twelve. Applications are open till thirty first August two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: According to a press release, the scheme targets students whose family income is less than ₹2 lakh per year. The funds can be used for tuition fees, books, and other educational expenses. CM Arvind Kejriwal emphasized the govt’s commitment to ensuring quality education for all, regardless of their socio-economic background.
normalised: According to a press release, the scheme targets students whose family income is less than rupee two lakh per year. The funds can be used for tuition fees, books, and other educational expenses. C-M Arvind Kejriwal emphasized the government's commitment to ensuring quality education for all, regardless of their socio-economic background.

unnormalised: The "Shiksha Uday" scheme builds upon existing initiatives like the "Merit-cum-Means Scholarship" and the "Post Matric Scholarship". Officials stated that this will benefit approximately 1.5 lakh students across Delhi. Parents can apply online through the official website: www.delhigovt.nic.in.
normalised: The "Shiksha Uday" scheme builds upon existing initiatives like the "Merit-cum-Means Scholarship" and the "Post Matric Scholarship". Officials stated that this will benefit approximately one point five lakh students across Delhi. Parents can apply online through the official website: w-w-w dot delhigovt dot n-i-c dot in.

unnormalised: Critics have welcomed the move but raised concerns about the implementation and accessibility of the scheme. They emphasize the need for awareness campaigns, especially in rural areas, to ensure that the intended beneficiaries are reached. Experts suggest simplifying the application process and providing assistance at the district level to maximize its impact.
normalised: Critics have welcomed the move but raised concerns about the implementation and accessibility of the scheme. They emphasize the need for awareness campaigns, especially in rural areas, to ensure that the intended beneficiaries are reached. Experts suggest simplifying the application process and providing assistance at the district level to maximize its impact.
